channel.title: Services Offered on Dijure | Digital Architectures with a hint of Java
channel.description: Recent content in Services Offered on Dijure | Digital Architectures with a hint of Java
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2022 by Dijure LLC · All rights reserved · Some design elements by Themefisher. Select images from Unsplash. Created using Hugo.

item.title: Advisory
item.description: Assessment of your team’s migration toward cloud native, Kubernetes, and distributed architectures. Let’s look at your maturity model and uncover strategies to increase your delivery.

item.title: Workshops
item.description: Workshops that range from hours to days. Together we create a workshop agenda to help your team move forward.

item.title: Presentations
item.description: Organizing a conference, meetup, or company event? Choose from my portfolio of topics or let’s create a new topic for your audience.

item.title: Multimedia
item.description: Based on your needs, presentations, workshops, and advisory sessions are arranged in a variety of forms: in-person, video conferencing, webinars, or podcasts. Available for international travel.

item.title: Software Architectures
item.description: Have a difficult problem? Need a new feature? Need a skeleton for best practices. Tap into my experience in designing, developing, and delivering commercial applications.

item.title: Authoring
item.description: Need an article, technical white paper, how-to, or assessment? Tap into my experience for an unbiased look at industry trends, best practices, and recommendations.

item.title: Hands-on Labs
item.description: My workshops include hands-on training to reinforce learning. Choose from my portfolio of Katacoda labs. We add new Katacoda labs to help you teach your technologies, techniques, and best practices.

item.title: Computer Science Professorship
item.description: While teaching the foundations, deep joy is connecting with aspiring software developers. What will the next 50 years will bring? Sometimes moments are found to provide insights into lessons learned.

item.title: Gratis
item.description: A friend in need is a friend indeed. Do you host a meetup? Are you a student? A non-profit? A struggling open-source team? How can I help?
